name: Entry
title: Gcloud
Logging
Entry
description:
Entry

An individual entry in a log.

Each log entry is composed of metadata and a payload. The metadata includes standard information used by Cloud Logging, such as when the entry was created and where it came from. The payload is the event record. Traditionally this is a message string, but in Cloud Logging it can also be a JSON or protocol buffer object. A single log can have entries with different payload types.

A log is a named collection of entries. Logs can be produced by Google Cloud Platform services, by third-party services, or by your applications. For example, the log compute.googleapis.com/activity_log is produced by Google Compute Engine. Logs are simply referenced by name in Gcloud. There is no Log type in Gcloud or Log resource in the Cloud Logging API.

examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
logging = gcloud.logging

entry = logging.entry
entry.payload = "Job started."
entry.log_name = "my_app_log"
entry.resource.type = "gae_app"
entry.resource.labels[:module_id] = "1"
entry.resource.labels[:version_id] = "20150925t173233"

logging.write_entries entry

methods.name: initialize
title: Gcloud
Logging
Entry#initialize
methods.description: Create a new Entry instance. The #resource attribute is pre-populated with a new Gcloud::Logging::Resource instance. See also Gcloud::Logging::Project#entry.

methods.name: log_name
title: Gcloud
Logging
Entry#log_name
methods.description:
The resource name of the log to which this log entry belongs. The format of the name is projects/<project-id>/logs/<log-id>. e.g. projects/my-projectid/logs/my_app_log and projects/1234567890/logs/library.googleapis.com%2Fbook_log

The log ID part of resource name must be less than 512 characters long and can only include the following characters: upper and lower case alphanumeric characters: [A-Za-z0-9]; and punctuation characters: forward-slash (/), underscore (_), hyphen (-), and period (.). Forward-slash (/) characters in the log ID must be URL-encoded.

methods.name: log_name=
title: Gcloud
Logging
Entry#log_name=
methods.description:
The resource name of the log to which this log entry belongs. The format of the name is projects/<project-id>/logs/<log-id>. e.g. projects/my-projectid/logs/my_app_log and projects/1234567890/logs/library.googleapis.com%2Fbook_log

The log ID part of resource name must be less than 512 characters long and can only include the following characters: upper and lower case alphanumeric characters: [A-Za-z0-9]; and punctuation characters: forward-slash (/), underscore (_), hyphen (-), and period (.). Forward-slash (/) characters in the log ID must be URL-encoded.

methods.name: resource
title: Gcloud
Logging
Entry#resource
methods.description: The monitored resource associated with this log entry. Example: a log entry that reports a database error would be associated with the monitored resource designating the particular database that reported the error.

methods.name: timestamp
title: Gcloud
Logging
Entry#timestamp
methods.description: The time the event described by the log entry occurred. If omitted, Cloud Logging will use the time the log entry is written.

methods.name: timestamp=
title: Gcloud
Logging
Entry#timestamp=
methods.description: The time the event described by the log entry occurred. If omitted, Cloud Logging will use the time the log entry is written.

methods.name: severity
title: Gcloud
Logging
Entry#severity
methods.description: The severity level of the log entry. The default value is DEFAULT.

methods.name: severity=
title: Gcloud
Logging
Entry#severity=
methods.description: The severity level of the log entry. The default value is DEFAULT.

methods.name: default?
title: Gcloud
Logging
Entry#default?
methods.description: Returns true if the severity level is DEFAULT.

methods.name: debug?
title: Gcloud
Logging
Entry#debug?
methods.description: Returns true if the severity level is DEBUG.

methods.name: info?
title: Gcloud
Logging
Entry#info?
methods.description: Returns true if the severity level is INFO.

methods.name: notice?
title: Gcloud
Logging
Entry#notice?
methods.description: Returns true if the severity level is NOTICE.

methods.name: warning?
title: Gcloud
Logging
Entry#warning?
methods.description: Returns true if the severity level is WARNING.

methods.name: error?
title: Gcloud
Logging
Entry#error?
methods.description: Returns true if the severity level is ERROR.

methods.name: critical?
title: Gcloud
Logging
Entry#critical?
methods.description: Returns true if the severity level is CRITICAL.

methods.name: alert?
title: Gcloud
Logging
Entry#alert?
methods.description: Returns true if the severity level is ALERT.

methods.name: emergency?
title: Gcloud
Logging
Entry#emergency?
methods.description: Returns true if the severity level is EMERGENCY.

methods.name: insert_id
title: Gcloud
Logging
Entry#insert_id
methods.description: A unique ID for the log entry. If you provide this field, the logging service considers other log entries in the same log with the same ID as duplicates which can be removed. If omitted, Cloud Logging will generate a unique ID for this log entry.

methods.name: insert_id=
title: Gcloud
Logging
Entry#insert_id=
methods.description: A unique ID for the log entry. If you provide this field, the logging service considers other log entries in the same log with the same ID as duplicates which can be removed. If omitted, Cloud Logging will generate a unique ID for this log entry.

methods.name: labels
title: Gcloud
Logging
Entry#labels
methods.description: A set of user-defined data that provides additional information about the log entry.

methods.name: labels=
title: Gcloud
Logging
Entry#labels=
methods.description: A set of user-defined data that provides additional information about the log entry.

methods.name: payload
title: Gcloud
Logging
Entry#payload
methods.description: The log entry payload, represented as either a string, a hash (JSON), or a hash (protocol buffer).

methods.name: payload=
title: Gcloud
Logging
Entry#payload=
methods.description: The log entry payload, represented as either a string, a hash (JSON), or a hash (protocol buffer).

methods.name: http_request
title: Gcloud
Logging
Entry#http_request
methods.description: Information about the HTTP request associated with this log entry, if applicable.

methods.name: operation
title: Gcloud
Logging
Entry#operation
methods.description: Information about an operation associated with the log entry, if applicable.
